Sentence: Shortly thereafter, Newman recognizes Tom Tristram, an old friend from the Civil War, wandering the gallery
Over dinner, Newman admits to the Tristrams that he (Newman) has come to Europe to find a wife to complete his (Newman) fortune
Several days later, Newman stops by the Tristram house only to find the visiting Claire, who politely invites him (Newman) to call on her (Claire)
Tristram encourages Newman to spend the summer traveling, promising that Claire will wait for his (Newman) return
Tristram's fireplace and packs his (Newman) bags for America
